title: Audio generation fails
body:
No matter what I try I can't get the audio files to generate. I've tried all the different tts models but none of the work. I also don't see any files inside `./data/audio`. The script exits with the error below.

```sh
Error merging audio files: Expecting value: line 1 column 1 (char 0)
Error converting text to speech: Expecting value: line 1 column 1 (char 0)
2025-01-31 16:01:45,871 - __main__ - ERROR - An error occurred in the process_content function: Expecting value: line 1 column 1 (char 0)
An error occurred: Expecting value: line 1 column 1 (char 0)
```

When I check my OpenAI API usage, I can see that the TTS HD endpoint is being used, so it seems that something fails when trying to save the audio file(s).

Also, the `./data/audio` folder gets created correctly but I don't see the `temp_audio_dir` folder. Could this be the issue?

Running on Ubuntu inside a separate Python env.

Any help is appreciated.
author: flatpackfan

comments.body:
I think i can help.

The issue is likely due to how the file is being handled by pydub after ffmpeg processes it. 

Ensure you have the latest version of pydub and ffmpeg.

You need to install the system-level ffmpeg binary, which pydub uses to process audio files.

You may need to explicitly tell pydub where to find both ffmpeg and ffprobe.

You can do this by setting the environment variables FFMPEG_BINARY and FFPROBE_BINARY in your Python code before using pydub.

If i can help further let me know.
